title: Selecting "No" to UAC Prompt when updating Firefox does a bunch of bullshit without telling you anything.
content:
If you select No to the UAC prompt when updating Firefox via Installer, it will install Firefox to "AppData\Local\Mozilla Firefox" without telling you, instead of overwriting the copy in Program Files or erroring out. Additionally it will create a new Profile and set this new Profile as the Default Profile without telling you. Lastly, it'll remove an existing Pinned shortcut on the Taskbar.

So you've now got 2 copies of Firefox installed, one of which you're not told anything about and an additional Firefox Profile with no indication that this happened nor any instructions on how to undo this nor how to change the default Profile.

title: Bookmarks missing in latest update
content:
This morning, 21-January-2025 at 8:45:59 AM my Firefox S/W was updated with version 134.0.2 (20250120135430). The "Other Bookmarks" file only contains about 20% of those I have saved. History is also not being save even though I have that checked in the Firefox Settings.

Tried restoring the bookmarks from a saved file. I can click on the file but can not install it.

This is the second time this has happened. When it happened previously Firefox Update recovered the Bookmarks on January 15, 2025 at 12:45:54 PM version 134.0.1 (20050113121357).

Firefox has been my browser for many years and has performed exceptionally. You were able to my recover the bookmarks last time. Hope you can do it again but if not I do have a copy on a USB drive.

Thank you for what you do and your dedication.

James.

title: Browsing History Loss & Backups
content:
Hey all, Some day (I suspect it was 2024-06-06), Firefox lost all my browsing history after starting it back up from a crash or an upgrade. I didn't have the time to investigate the cause of this problem back then, but now I need some information from my old browsing history before that date. Interestingly, History -> 'Show all History' -> 'Import and Backup' -> 'Restore' lists a couple of dates well before the aforementioned date of data loss.

Are these dates automatically created recovery points (backups), and if so, when/under which circumstances does Firefox create such a backup? Where in the filesystem (Linux)/ Firefox profile does the backup data reside? I don't want to recover that old history data since that means to replace my recent browsing history. (How) can I view/extract these browsing history backups without going through an actual backup recovery process? (E.g. like, I can do with SQLite/SQLitebrowser and the places.sqlite file)?


(I installed Firefox from Ubuntu packages on my Debian Bookworm system. I don't know which version it was back then. Could have been 126)

Thank you very much!

title: Firefox randomly drops characters from barcode scanner
content:
Firefox on Ubuntu randomly drops characters from bardodes scanned by external USB barcode scanner. We are 100% sure that barcode scanner works properly - barcodes scanned into vi editor running in bash terminal windows works perfectly. Barcodes scanned into Google Chrome works perfectly too. It seems that the only application with this problem is Firefox. For example we can scan 1234567890 and get 124567890 or 123456890. Barcode scanner types characters extremely fast, probably this is a problem. The problem persists scanning into text fields in the Web pages and into the Firefox address bar too - so could not be a web-site problem. No addons installed.

How this problem could be fixed? We have the only option for now - switch to Google Chrome:-(

Ubuntu 21.04.1 LTS Firefox 134.0-1

Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS (GNU/Linux 6.8.0-51-generic x86_64)

title: Local Storage Issues with Firefox Portable on Windows 11
content:
Hello, I am experiencing unexpected behaviour with local storage in Firefox Portable ESR 102.1.0 on Windows 11. In particular, the data is not deleted as expected after closing the application, even after clearing the cache in my code, the data persists when I open the application the next time. This behaviour is observed under windows10 but is common under windows11.

I suspect that this issue may be related to:

  • Interactions between Firefox Portable's cache management and Windows 11's system-level caching
  • Specific behavior of the ESR 102.1.0 version on Windows 11

I would appreciate it if you could investigate this issue and provide any insights or solutions.

title: cannot log into Mercari on Laptop, but can on phone
content:
Computer: Lenovo Y70-70 laptop Phone: Motorola Edge+ 5G UW (2022) OS: Microsoft Windows 10 Home Firefox: Version 134.0.1 (64-bit)

When I awoke my laptop from sleep this morning, the opened Mercari tab did not load correctly, forcing me to log out and attempt to reset it. It acted as if I was not logged in to begin with and would not load the correct account information. When I logged out and then attempted to log back in, I was given an error that stated that the password or account was incorrect. I contacted Mercari Support for assistance, first, as I could not log into my account on an Edge browser, either. When I opened a Chrome browser, it auto-logged me in without issue. Mercari support assisted me for close to 13 hours, and eventually changed my email address associated with my account. Unfortunately, after that, I still could not get logged in, still getting the same wrong password or account message on my laptop. HOWEVER, when I opened firefox on my phone and attempted to log in there, it worked, using the same account and password information as I had attempted on my laptop. Additionally, I was able to log into my Mercari app on my phone, as well as BOTH Chrome and Edge on my laptop. It is only Firefox on my laptop which is not accepting the correct information. I have cleared my cache on firefox, which did not work. I have done an end task on Firefox on my laptop and restarted it, which did not work. I have restarted my laptop, which did not work. I power cycled my T-mobile router, which did not work. I even connected to the internet via hot-spot through my motorola phone, which also did not work. I can log into Mercari on any other way that I attempt, using the same account and password, EXCEPT for Firefox on my Lenovo. Firefox claims that it is up to date and will not find a newer update. Nothing was altered, to my knowledge, between putting my laptop to sleep last night and waking it up this morning. No updates, power interruptions, or anything that I am aware of. I am at my wit's end and am out of ideas for things to try to fix this. Please help. I do NOT want to have to run Chrome again, just to be able to log into a single page on my laptop.
creator: searchcoyote

title: Cannot pin extensions to toolbar
content:
Recently I am no longer able to pin extensions to the tool bar.

I click on the puzzle piece and get to the list of installed extensions. Next to each extension I click on the three dots to get to the pull down menu, and it only shows remove, report and manage. Within manage there is nothing about pinning.

I went through this with the support group for one of my extension thinking it was an issue with them,, but after troubleshooting with them they say it is an issue with Firefox.

Sam issue in private windows, and same issue in troubleshoot mode.

Firefox 134.0.1 (64bit); Windows 11

I was able to pin extensions in the past. Is this because of a recent automatic Firefox upgrade? Any know solutions? Thanks
